name: 01-Project-Overview
content:
Telco Fault Severity -

Project Overview

Objective:

The Telco Fault Severity project focuses on analyzing and predicting the severity of network faults in telecommunication infrastructure. By classifying faults into severity levels, the system helps operators prioritize incident resolution, minimize downtime, and enhance customer satisfaction.

Approach:

The solution follows a structured methodology:

  1. Data Profiling – Assess data structure, completeness, and key attributes.
  2. Data Quality Checks – Identify and fix missing or inconsistent records.
  3. Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) – Examine fault distribution, log features, and event correlations.
  4. Model Training – Use a Decision Tree model (via Spark ML) to predict fault severity.
  5. Model Prediction – Apply the trained model on new/unseen data to predict severity outcomes.
  6. Predictive Analysis – Interpret results to highlight patterns, root causes, and action priorities.

Significance:

Effective fault severity prediction is essential for network resilience. By identifying critical faults early, telecom operators can:

  • Allocate resources efficiently.
  • Improve service reliability.
  • Reduce churn from service disruptions.

Benefits:

  • Reduced Downtime: Quick identification of high-severity faults.
  • Improved Customer Experience: Stable network improves loyalty and satisfaction.
  • Efficient Resource Allocation: Prioritize critical events for faster resolution.
  • Proactive Fault Management: Anticipate and resolve issues before escalation.
  • Cost Savings: Minimized revenue loss from outages and optimized operations.
  • Continuous Improvement: Ongoing monitoring improves long-term infrastructure reliability.

Expected Outcomes:

  • Predictive fault severity classification (low to critical).
  • EDA-driven insights into event patterns, severity by location, and log features.
  • Actionable intelligence for network maintenance strategies and service reliability planning.
